extendedIngredients.name: baby bok choy
extendedIngredients.original: 8 ounces baby bok choy, stalks separated

title: Beef and Star Anise Noodle Soup
summary: Beef and Star Anise Noodle Soup might be just the main course you are searching for. Watching your figure? This gluten free and dairy free recipe has 781 calories, 32g of protein, and 71g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 4 and costs $4.48 per serving. If you have beef broth, soy sauce, pepper, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the salt you could follow this main course with the Apple Turnovers Recipe as a dessert. 1 person were impressed by this recipe. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for Autumn. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 79%. This score is pretty good. Similar recipes are Carrot and Star Anise Soup, Carrot Soup with Star Anise, and Creamy Carrot Soup With Star Anise.
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine ribs with soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chiles, and star anise. Cover and chill at least 1 hour and up to 1 day, stirring occasionally.                                                                                                 Preheat oven to 300. In an 8-qt. pot with ovenproof lid, heat oil over high heat until almost smoking. Lift ribs from marinade (save marinade) and brown on all sides, 4 to 6 minutes total.                                                                                                 Add marinade, broth, and 2 cups water. Cover pot; bring to a boil. Cook in oven until meat is extremely tender, about 3 hours.                                                                                                 Remove bones from ribs and discard. Cut larger rib meat into pieces to make 4 equal portions. Skim excess fat from surface of broth if you like. Return meat to broth. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add bok choy; let sit, covered, a few minutes to wilt.                                                                                                 Meanwhile, bring a 2-qt. pot of water to a boil. Add noodles and cook until tender, about 3 minutes for fresh and 8 minutes for dried. Drain noodles but don't rinse. Divide evenly among 4 serving bowls. Top with rib pieces and bok choy, dividing evenly, and ladle about 1 1/2 cups broth into each bowl. Serve immediately.                                                                                                Make ahead: Once ribs are cooked (through step 3), chill overnight and up to 2 days ahead. Remove any solid fat on top. As directed in step 4, remove bones and cut meat into pieces. Reheat meat in broth over medium heat, add bok choy, and proceed with step                                                                                                 Note: Nutritional analysis is per serving; sodium amount varies depending on noodles.

steps.step: In a medium bowl, combine ribs with soy sauce, ginger, garlic, chiles, and star anise. Cover and chill at least 1 hour and up to 1 day, stirring occasionally.
In an 8-qt. pot with ovenproof lid, heat oil over high heat until almost smoking. Lift ribs from marinade (save marinade) and brown on all sides, 4 to 6 minutes total.
Add marinade, broth, and 2 cups water. Cover pot; bring to a boil. Cook in oven until meat is extremely tender, about 3 hours.
Remove bones from ribs and discard.
Cut larger rib meat into pieces to make 4 equal portions. Skim excess fat from surface of broth if you like. Return meat to broth. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add bok choy; let sit, covered, a few minutes to wilt.
Meanwhile, bring a 2-qt. pot of water to a boil.
Add noodles and cook until tender, about 3 minutes for fresh and 8 minutes for dried.
Drain noodles but don't rinse. Divide evenly among 4 serving bowls. Top with rib pieces and bok choy, dividing evenly, and ladle about 1 1/2 cups broth into each bowl.
Make ahead: Once ribs are cooked (through step 3), chill overnight and up to 2 days ahead.
Remove any solid fat on top. As directed in step 4, remove bones and cut meat into pieces. Reheat meat in broth over medium heat, add bok choy, and proceed with step
